intro: Pouzolzia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with a fine layer of white hairs. Pouzolzia pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
